text: here are my top two option strategies for small accounts if you have a small trading account you are at a perilous point in your trading career because it is very difficult to create logical risk reward relationships with such constrained Capital so the goal of this video is to walk you through the exact two strategies that I would use and did use when I did the small stack segment a long time ago that tested a 5,000 account the goal at the end of the video is for you to have two more tools to add to your toolkit so that you can hopefully find different approaches other than the vertical spreads that are slowly losing you money and not making you enough for them to make sense what's up everybody Eric here welcome back to all the outliers shout out to the patreon family let's get straight into the top two option strategies for small accounts okay first let's talk about the scenario that we're in because it's not good small accounts in my world are anything below 150,000 200,000 it doesn't really matter you might see that number be like Oh okay that's giant number it's not the point the point is is that anything really below portfolio margin there are different things that apply to you but the smaller your account is on this spectrum the more constrained you are and that's why you are compromised at the starting point because you are unable to

text: conditions ratio diagonal we want to be directional here what are the benefits of these different strategies well the coverage strangle it's super forgiving because if you're wrong on your cash secured put and you're assigned you're assigned an asset and if we're trading something like an index or sector ETF or a strong stock that's not the worst case you could just hold on to that position plenty of people hold on to trades for really long periods of time but that gives you plenty of time to be right and it offers inherent diversification depending on what you're choosing to trade which is great when we look at something though like the ratio diag Al it's very Capital efficient you expose yourself to leverage return potential and these are defined risk right out of the gate so you can immediately understand what your risk profile is on entry and it's pretty efficient whereas if we look at something like the coverage strangle it's a little bit different because in here they're very expensive if you're looking to cash secure a position you have to put aside quite a bit of money in order to do that so they also can work very slowly let's say you're assigned on something and it continues to Plum it down you could choose to have some sort of stop loss in place there if you want to be able to redeploy your capital or you might be holding something underwater for sometime

▬ ABOUT ERIK  ▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
My name is Erik, I'm a Marine veteran, options trader, real estate and angel investor. From 2007, I spent over 30,000 hours honing my skillset and became a first generation millionaire before 30. I'm is passionate about self-development, life experiences, human performance, and helping others grow. I launched the esInvests YouTube channel and the Outlier community to share his experience and empower others to proactively craft their futures. 

DISCLAIMER:
The content presented is for informational purposes only and should not be considered as financial advice. esInvests, its affiliates, and employees are not responsible for any investment decisions made based on the information presented in these videos. All investment and trading activities involve risk, and viewers should carefully consider their financial situation, investment goals, and risk tolerance before making any investment decisions.

Any opinions, news, research, analyses, or other information contained in these videos are provided as general market commentary and do not constitute investment advice. esInvests does not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or reliability of any information presented in these videos and is not liable for any losses or damages arising from the use of or reliance on this information. Viewers are encouraged to seek professional financial advice from a licensed investment advisor before making any investment decisions.

By accessing and watching these videos, viewers acknowledge and agree to these disclosures and terms of use.
